result.execSummary:
The defendant Camellia Cassandra Joiner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Camellia Cassandra Joiner is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Camellia Cassandra Joiner was found guilty of Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: PROBATION REVIEW HEARING April 8, 2016 at 1:15 p.m. in Br. 38.

miscConds.notes: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by DOC.  Court found the domestic abuse surcharge is applicable.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order; and due to this DV conviction she may never possess firearms or ammunition.

No contact with victim unless approved by the Court or agent.
No firearms, weapons.

Successfully complete anger management counseling; and successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Pay all supervision fees as determined by DOC.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment.  Successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Camellia Cassandra Joiner

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Camellia Cassandra Joiner not in court, defendant in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for probation review hearing.  Defendant is being held for violation of probation.  No further action taken.
Per telephone call from Probation Dept., defendant's probation has been or is in the process of being revoked.  4-08-2016 review hearing is cancelled.

Defendant Camellia Cassandra Joiner in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant sentenced to serve 4 months in the House of Correction with credit for 3 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 12 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Successfully complete Anger Management counseling.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS approved by the court or agent.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction she may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 38.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for April 8, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Camellia Cassandra Joiner in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter set for jury trial today but has resolved.  AS to count 1:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
Counts 2 and 3 are orderd dismissed.  Sentencing is adjourned to 1-4-2016  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Camellia Cassandra Joiner in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea hearing but defense requested a jury trial. Case adjourned to Branch 38.  Jury trial scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Camellia Cassandra Joiner in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense working toward resolution of this matter through a DPA. Case adjourned for a projected guilty plea date before branch 38.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge KREMERS.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Wagner, Br. 38.

Defendant Camellia Cassandra Joiner in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel requests case be set for a Status Conference. Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Status Conference.  Status conference scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Camellia Cassandra Joiner in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appearing in court, court VACATED stayed bench warrant. Discussion regarding defendant's missed court appearance. Defense counsel requested an adjourned Pretrial Conference, GRANTED. Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference to branch 23.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Gabriela A Leija in court.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant NOT in court. Case set for Pretrial Conference. Defense counsel requests case be set for Calendar Call date for reasons placed on the record. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued, but STAYED pending calendar call date. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Calendar call scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.     No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Millissa C; Latisha S.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Camellia Cassandra Joiner in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Defendant Camellia Cassandra Joiner in custody.   David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
